result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lyvia Marie Olson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: on Pet for Appt of an Atty.              To SRN. jaf
for Appt of an Atty, Affidavit of Indigency filed by DE. jaf

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, S.A.M.K.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:48 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Lyvia Marie Olson in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Lyvia Marie Olson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does not qualify for PD, PFAC given. DE confirms address. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Court orders bond and next court date.  DE approved to appear by zoom.  Adjourned at 1:49 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed by DA's office on behalf of Victim Witness. bph
